intro: Malleola forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' malleola, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to nutrient-poor environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous areas where it can withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its structure consists of narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Malleola forbesii is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
